item.title: By: Jackie North
item.dc:creator: Jackie North
item.description: Many thanks for going to the trouble of explaining this recipe. I am about to try it however noticed that 1/3 of a cup of icing sugar would not be 200 grams. Checked and found out it should be 1 and 1/3rd cup of icing sugar. Just a small typpo I am sure. Again many thanks.
item.content:encoded: Many thanks for going to the trouble of explaining this recipe. I am about to try it however noticed that 1/3 of a cup of icing sugar would not be 200 grams. Checked and found out it should be 1 and 1/3rd cup of icing sugar. Just a small typpo I am sure. Again many thanks.

item.title: By: Tracy In Sydney
item.dc:creator: Tracy In Sydney
item.description: Funny I googled looking for friand recipe's to try out my new tin and funny how I find a fellow sydneysider's site, these look lovely and are in the oven as I type. I made lemon curd a few weeks ago and this is just the thing to use the curd up and try out my new tin at the same time. Off to check out the rest of your blog for more yummy recipes!! Hugs Tracy
item.content:encoded: Funny I googled looking for friand recipe’s to try out my new tin and funny how I find a fellow sydneysider’s site, these look lovely and are in the oven as I type. I made lemon curd a few weeks ago and this is just the thing to use the curd up and try out my new tin at the same time. Off to check out the rest of your blog for more yummy recipes!! Hugs Tracy

item.title: By: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.dc:creator: Maria@TheGourmetChallenge
item.description: Oh yum, they look delicious! I'm in love with lemon curd at the moment, so you're making me salivate!
item.content:encoded: Oh yum, they look delicious! I’m in love with lemon curd at the moment, so you’re making me salivate!

item.title: By: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.dc:creator: Julia @ MÃ©langer
item.description: Your friand tin is so cute - I love the imprint at the bottom. I do like friands and the zestiness of the lemon would be just delicious!
item.content:encoded: Your friand tin is so cute – I love the imprint at the bottom. I do like friands and the zestiness of the lemon would be just delicious!

item.title: By: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.dc:creator: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.description: The lemon curd is so beautiful, it's a lovely idea to swirl it through the cakes.
item.content:encoded: The lemon curd is so beautiful, it’s a lovely idea to swirl it through the cakes.

item.title: By: Y
item.dc:creator: Y
item.description: Tasty! I love lemon curd and friands, so the two of them together seems like a particularly nice bonus :)
item.content:encoded: Tasty! I love lemon curd and friands, so the two of them together seems like a particularly nice bonus ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.dc:creator: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.description: They look fantastic! I love the moistness of friands but I admit I don't bake them often enough. These are proving inspirational though :)
item.content:encoded: They look fantastic! I love the moistness of friands but I admit I don’t bake them often enough. These are proving inspirational though ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Steph
item.dc:creator: Steph
item.description: Lemon curd goes so well with so many things doesn't it? And Portuguese egg tarts sound like a great way to use up your leftover yolks, I can never decide what to do with mine!
item.content:encoded: Lemon curd goes so well with so many things doesn’t it? And Portuguese egg tarts sound like a great way to use up your leftover yolks, I can never decide what to do with mine!
